attributes.action: grant Victoria Cross war hero Tul Bahadur Pun British citizenship.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
VC Gurkha Tul Bahadur Pun won our highest bravery medal for single-handedly charging the Japanese during WWII.
The 84-year-old now lives in a shack with no water or sanitation in Nepal.
He has heart problems, diabetes and failing sight and hearing and has to be carried in a basket for eight miles to see a doctor.
He served the British army for 18 years and won 10 medals and wants to spend his last days among old comrades in the UK.
But the government will not let him live here because he has "failed to demonstrate strong ties with the UK."
This is a disgrace. If winning a VC for this country is not a strong tie - what is?

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
